svg.desc: Gridmapper, a simple tool to create dungeon maps

text.tspan: f : floor / erase (like using the mouse)
d : a door, repeat to rotate
use v for the gate variant
$ : a secret door, repeat to rotate
c : a concealed door, repeat to rotate
We're going to show you how to use this thing.
You can move around the map using your mouse.
Or you can use the Arrow keys to move around.
You can draw the floor using your mouse.
Or you can use Shift and the Arrow keys.
In general I recomend using the Arrow keys to move.
Use f to draw or erase the floor.
Things like traps, statues and pillars are easy.
Just use the appropriate key: t, b, p.
Doors are trickier. Use d to rotate the door.
Watch: left, top, right, bottom, and back to left.
To remove a door you added
Secret doors and conceiled doors work just the same.
Use $ and c to set and rotate them into place.
Use s to set and rotate them into place.
Use v to use a variant.
You can draw on two layers.
Use z and y to switch layers.
Place a door and rotate it into place.
Use v to select the gate variant.
Use n to place and rotate diagonals.
You can draw walls using w.
Thus, walls work just like doors.
Note the shift by half a square!
keeps the cursor on the walls.
Doors and walls no longer rotate.
Move from wall to wall and use d, $, c, g, w or x.
Use m to leave Wall Mode.
Use the number keys 0-9 to add labels.
Well, that's it. The rest is up to you.
What lies beyond the secret doors to the east?
